main event: Two unidentified objects were reported over Niagara Falls AFD, New York on August 21, 1957.
interesting points: One object was twice as large as a star, and the other was three times as large as a star.
The objects were bright white, changing momentarily to orange.
The objects moved very fast, changing direction irregularly, and some disappeared over the horizon.
Theodolite measurements indicated the objects were likely the planets Venus and Jupiter.
Interceptor pilots reported the objects appeared to be stars due to their stationary position after 232 miles of pursuit and 38,000 feet of altitude change.
result: identified as planets Venus and Jupiter
sighted object: two bright white objects, changing to orange, of varying sizes larger than stars
witnesses: tower operators, pilots, and ground crew
photographs: no photographs included in the report
